org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch

Class IterativeLineSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.IterativeLineSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineSearch
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch, BacktrackingLineSearch, StrongWolfeInterpolationLineSearch

    abstract class IterativeLineSearch
extends java.lang.Object
implements LineSearch
    Abstract class that all iterative line search algorithms should extend.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) double initialStepSize
      The value of the initial step size (this value is set automatically using the chosen step size initialization method).

      The objective function instance.

    • Method Detail

      • computeStepSize

        public double computeStepSize(Vector point,
                              Vector direction,
                              Vector previousPoint,
                              Vector previousDirection,
                              double previousStepSize)
        Computes the step size value using the implemented algorithm.
        Specified by:
        computeStepSize in interface LineSearch
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        previousPoint - The previous point selected by the optimization algorithm (used by some step size initialization methods for iterative line search algorithms).
        previousDirection - The previous direction selected by the optimization algorithm (used by some step size initialization methods for iterative line search algorithms).
        previousStepSize - The previous step size used by the optimization algorithm (used by some step size initialization methods for iterative line search algorithms).
        Returns:
        A step size value that satisfies certain criteria that depend on the algorithm choice.

      • performLineSearch

        public abstract double performLineSearch(Vector point,
                                         Vector direction)
        Perform the actual line search after an initial value for the step size has been selected. The initialStepSize must have been initialized before this method is called.
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        Returns:
        A step size value that satisfies certain criteria that depend on the algorithm choice.

      • getStepSizeInitializationMethod

        public StepSizeInitializationMethod getStepSizeInitializationMethod()
        Gets the step size initialization method used by this iterative line search instance.
        Returns:
        The step size initialization method used by this iterative line search instance.

      • setStepSizeInitializationMethod

        public void setStepSizeInitializationMethod(StepSizeInitializationMethod stepSizeInitializationMethod)
        Sets the step size initialization method for this iterative line search instance. If the selected method is StepSizeInitializationMethod.CONSTANT and the desired initial step size value to be used is not 1, then setInitialStepSize(double) must be called as well to set the constant value of the initial step size.
        Parameters:
        stepSizeInitializationMethod - The step size initialization method to be used.

      • getInitialStepSize

        public double getInitialStepSize()
        Gets the initial step size value used by this iterative line search instance. If the selected step size initialization method is StepSizeInitializationMethod.CONSTANT, then the initial step value can have any positive real number value. Otherwise, the initial step size value that is returned by this method is not actually being used by this iterative line search instance. Note that if the step size initialization method is StepSizeInitializationMethod.UNIT, then the initial step size value that is always used by this iterative line search instance is 1.
        Returns:
        The value of the initial step size.

      • setInitialStepSize

        public void setInitialStepSize(double initialStepSize)
        Sets the initial step size value used by this iterative line search instance. This method is only useful if the selected step size initialization method is StepSizeInitializationMethod.CONSTANT. Otherwise, the initial step size variable is not actually being used by this iterative line search instance. Note that if the step size initialization method is StepSizeInitializationMethod.UNIT, then the initial step size value that is always used by this iterative line search instance is 1.
        Parameters:
        initialStepSize - The initial step size value to use. The value provided must be a positive real number.
